CC   -!- FUNCTION: Activation of long-chain fatty acids for both synthesis
CC       of cellular lipids, and degradation via beta-oxidation. Plays an
CC       important role in fatty acid metabolism in brain and the acyl-CoAs
CC       produced may be utilized exclusively for the synthesis of the
CC       brain lipid.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY:
CC       Reaction=a long-chain fatty acid + ATP + CoA = a long-chain fatty
CC         acyl-CoA + AMP + diphosphate; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:15421,
CC         ChEBI:CHEBI:30616, ChEBI:CHEBI:33019, ChEBI:CHEBI:57287,
CC         ChEBI:CHEBI:57560, ChEBI:CHEBI:83139, ChEBI:CHEBI:456215;
CC         EC=6.2.1.3;
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Mg(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:18420;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Mitochondrion outer membrane {ECO:0000250};
CC       Single-pass type III membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Peroxisome
CC       membrane {ECO:0000250}; Single-pass type III membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Microsome membrane {ECO:0000250}; Single-pass type
CC       III membrane protein {ECO:0000250}. Endoplasmic reticulum membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Single-pass type III membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=9;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=Q9UKU0-4; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Long, v2;
CC         IsoId=Q9UKU0-1; Sequence=VSP_037819;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Short;
CC         IsoId=Q9UKU0-2; Sequence=VSP_021024, VSP_000241;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q9UKU0-3; Sequence=VSP_021024;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=5; Synonyms=v4;
CC         IsoId=Q9UKU0-5; Sequence=VSP_037823;
CC       Name=6; Synonyms=v5;

CC       Name=7; Synonyms=v3;
CC         IsoId=Q9UKU0-7; Sequence=VSP_037820, VSP_037822;
CC       Name=8; Synonyms=v1;
CC         IsoId=Q9UKU0-8; Sequence=VSP_037819, VSP_021024;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=9;
CC         IsoId=Q9UKU0-9; Sequence=VSP_046954;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed predominantly in erythrocyte
CC       precursors, in particular in reticulocytes, fetal blood cells
CC       derived from fetal liver, hemopoietic stem cells from cord blood,
CC       bone marrow and brain. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10548543}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expression is low at earlier stages of
CC       erythroid development but is very high in reticulocytes.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=A chromosomal aberration involving ACSL6 may be a
CC       cause of myelodysplastic syndrome with basophilia. Translocation
CC       t(5;12)(q31;p13) with ETV6. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10502316}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=A chromosomal aberration involving ACSL6 may be a
CC       cause of acute myelogenous leukemia with eosinophilia.
CC       Translocation t(5;12)(q31;p13) with ETV6.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10502316}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=A chromosomal aberration involving ACSL6 may be a
CC       cause of acute eosinophilic leukemia (AEL). Translocation
CC       t(5;12)(q31;p13) with ETV6. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10502316}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the ATP-dependent AMP-binding enzyme
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [27]
RP   VARIANT LQT11 LEU-1570.
RX   PubMed=18093912; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0710527105;
RA   Chen L., Marquardt M.L., Tester D.J., Sampson K.J., Ackerman M.J.,
RA   Kass R.S.;
RT   "Mutation of an A-kinase-anchoring protein causes long-QT syndrome.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 104:20990-20995(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Scaffolding protein that assembles several protein
CC       kinases and phosphatases on the centrosome and Golgi apparatus.
CC       Required to maintain the integrity of the Golgi apparatus
CC       (PubMed:10202149, PubMed:15047863). Required for microtubule
CC       nucleation at the cis-side of the Golgi apparatus
CC       (PubMed:15047863, PubMed:19242490). Required for association of
CC       the centrosomes with the poles of the bipolar mitotic spindle
CC       during metaphase (PubMed:25657325). In complex with PDE4DIP
CC       isoform 13/MMG8/SMYLE, recruits CAMSAP2 to the Golgi apparatus and
CC       tethers non-centrosomal minus-end microtubules to the Golgi, an
CC       important step for polarized cell movement (PubMed:27666745,
CC       PubMed:28814570). In complex with PDE4DIP isoform 13/MMG8/SMYLE,
CC       EB1/MAPRE1 and CDK5RAP2, contributes to microtubules nucleation
CC       and extension also from the centrosome to the cell periphery
CC       (PubMed:29162697). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10202149,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15047863, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19242490,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25657325, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27666745,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:28814570, ECO:0000269|PubMed:29162697}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform 4: Associated with the N-methyl-D-aspartate
CC       receptor and is specifically found in the neuromuscular junction
CC       (NMJ) as well as in neuronal synapses, suggesting a role in the
CC       organization of postsynaptic specializations.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9482789}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with the regulatory region of protein kinase N
CC       (PKN), protein phosphatase 2A (PP2A), protein phosphatase 1 (PP1)
CC       and the immature non-phosphorylated form of PKC epsilon. Interacts
CC       with CIP4 and FNBP1 (PubMed:15047863). Interacts with chloride
CC       intracellular channel proteins CLIC1, CLIC4 and CLIC5
CC       (PubMed:12163479). CSNK1D binding promotes its centrosomal
CC       subcellular location (PubMed:12270714). Interacts with
CC       GM130/GOLGA2; leading to recruitment to the Golgi apparatus
CC       (PubMed:19242490). Interacts with KCNQ1; targets protein kinase A
CC       (PKA) catalytic and regulatory subunits and protein phosphatase 1
CC       (PP1), to the heterodimer KCNQ1-KCNE1 (PubMed:11799244). Interacts
CC       with PDE4DIP isoform 13/MMG8/SMYLE; this interaction stabilizes
CC       both proteins (PubMed:25217626, PubMed:27666745, PubMed:28814570).
CC       In complex with PDE4DIP isoform 13, recruits CAMSAP2 to the Golgi
CC       apparatus (PubMed:27666745, PubMed:28814570). Forms a
CC       pericentrosomal complex with CDK5RAP2, EB1/MAPRE1 and PDE4DIP
CC       isoform 13; within this complex, MAPRE1 binding to CDK5RAP2 may be
CC       mediated by PDE4DIP (PubMed:29162697). Interacts with MAPRE1 and
CC       MAPRE3 (PubMed:28814570). Interacts (via C-terminus) with CAMSAP2;
CC       this interaction is much stronger in the presence of PDE4DIP
CC       isoform 13/MMG8/SMYLE (PubMed:27666745). Interacts with CAMSAP3
CC       (PubMed:28089391). Interacts (via C-terminus) with the gamma-
CC       tubulin ring complex (gamma-TuRC), composed of gamma-tubulin,
CC       TUBGCP2, TUBGCP3, TUBGCP4, TUBGCP5 and TUBGCP6 (PubMed:27666745).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11799244, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12163479,

CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25217626, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27666745}.
CC       Cytoplasm {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9915845}. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton,
CC       microtubule organizing center, centrosome
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12270714, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14654843,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25657325, ECO:0000269|PubMed:29162697,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9915845}. Note=Cytoplasmic in parietal cells
CC       (PubMed:9915845). Recruited to the Golgi apparatus by GM130/GOLGA2
CC       (PubMed:25657325). Localization at the centrosome versus Golgi
CC       apparatus may be cell line-dependent. In SKBr3 and HEK293F cells,
CC       exclusively located at the centrosome (PubMed:29162697). In HeLa,
CC       MDA-MB231 and RPE-1 cells, detected at the Golgi apparatus
CC       (PubMed:25217626, PubMed:29162697). In SK-BR-3 cells, recruited to
CC       the centrosome in the presence of CDK5RAP2 (PubMed:29162697).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25217626, ECO:0000269|PubMed:25657325,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:29162697, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9915845}.

CC   -!- DISEASE: Long QT syndrome 11 (LQT11) [MIM:611820]: A heart
CC       disorder characterized by a prolonged QT interval on the ECG and
CC       polymorphic ventricular arrhythmias. They cause syncope and sudden
CC       death in response to exercise or emotional stress, and can present
CC       with a sentinel event of sudden cardiac death in infancy.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18093912}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

CC         IsoId=P05091-2; Sequence=VSP_046715;

CC   -!- POLYMORPHISM: Genetic variation in ALDH2 is responsible for
CC       individual differences in responses to drinking alcohol
CC       [MIM:610251]. Allele ALDH2*2 is associated with a very high
CC       incidence of acute alcohol intoxication in Orientals and South
CC       American Indians, as compared to Caucasians.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8561277}.

CC       activity. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23348840,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23575228}.

CC       pole. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, microtubule organizing center,
CC       centrosome, centriole. Mitochondrion intermembrane space.

CC       which anchors the mother centriole to the plasma membrane.

RP   VARIANT PCH10 HIS-140, FUNCTION, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=24766810; DOI=10.1016/j.cell.2014.03.049;
RA   Schaffer A.E., Eggens V.R., Caglayan A.O., Reuter M.S., Scott E.,
RA   Coufal N.G., Silhavy J.L., Xue Y., Kayserili H., Yasuno K.,
RA   Rosti R.O., Abdellateef M., Caglar C., Kasher P.R., Cazemier J.L.,
RA   Weterman M.A., Cantagrel V., Cai N., Zweier C., Altunoglu U.,
RA   Satkin N.B., Aktar F., Tuysuz B., Yalcinkaya C., Caksen H.,
RA   Bilguvar K., Fu X.D., Trotta C.R., Gabriel S., Reis A., Gunel M.,
RA   Baas F., Gleeson J.G.;
RT   "CLP1 founder mutation links tRNA splicing and maturation to
RT   cerebellar development and neurodegeneration.";
RL   Cell 157:651-663(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Polynucleotide kinase that can phosphorylate the 5'-
CC       hydroxyl groups of double-stranded RNA (dsRNA), single-stranded
CC       RNA (ssRNA), double-stranded DNA (dsDNA) and double-stranded
CC       DNA:RNA hybrids. dsRNA is phosphorylated more efficiently than
CC       dsDNA, and the RNA component of a DNA:RNA hybrid is phosphorylated
CC       more efficiently than the DNA component. Plays a key role in both
CC       tRNA splicing and mRNA 3'-end formation. Component of the tRNA
CC       splicing endonuclease complex: phosphorylates the 5'-terminus of
CC       the tRNA 3'-exon during tRNA splicing; this phosphorylation event
CC       is a prerequisite for the subsequent ligation of the two exon
CC       halves and the production of a mature tRNA (PubMed:24766809,
CC       PubMed:24766810). Its role in tRNA splicing and maturation is
CC       required for cerebellar development (PubMed:24766809,
CC       PubMed:24766810). Component of the pre-mRNA cleavage complex II
CC       (CF-II), which seems to be required for mRNA 3'-end formation.
CC       Also phosphorylates the 5'-terminus of exogenously introduced
CC       short interfering RNAs (siRNAs), which is a necessary prerequisite
CC       for their incorporation into the RNA-induced silencing complex
CC       (RISC). However, endogenous siRNAs and microRNAs (miRNAs) that are
CC       produced by the cleavage of dsRNA precursors by DICER1 already
CC       contain a 5'-phosphate group, so this protein may be dispensible
CC       for normal RNA-mediated gene silencing.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17495927, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18648070,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24766809, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24766810}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY:
CC       Reaction=5'-dephospho-(DNA) + ATP = ADP + H(+) + phospho-5'-(DNA);
CC         Xref=Rhea:RHEA:15669, Rhea:RHEA-COMP:13180, Rhea:RHEA-
CC         COMP:13184, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:30616,
CC         ChEBI:CHEBI:136412, ChEBI:CHEBI:136416, ChEBI:CHEBI:456216;
CC         EC=2.7.1.78; Evidence={ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03035};
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY:
CC       Reaction=5'-dephospho-(RNA) + ATP = 5'-end-(RNA) + ADP + H(+);
CC         Xref=Rhea:RHEA:54580, Rhea:RHEA-COMP:13935, Rhea:RHEA-
CC         COMP:13936, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:30616,
CC         ChEBI:CHEBI:138282, ChEBI:CHEBI:138284, ChEBI:CHEBI:456216;
CC         EC=2.7.1.78; Evidence={ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03035};
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Mg(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:18420;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03035,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:17495927};
CC       Name=Mn(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29035;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03035,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:17495927};
CC       Name=Ni(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:49786;
CC         Evidence={ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03035,
CC         ECO:0000269|PubMed:17495927};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the tRNA splicing endonuclease complex,
CC       composed of CLP1, TSEN2, TSEN15, TSEN34 and TSEN54
CC       (PubMed:24766809). Component of pre-mRNA cleavage complex II (CF-
CC       II). Also associates with numerous components of the pre-mRNA
CC       cleavage complex I (CF-I/CFIm), including NUDT21, CPSF2, CPSF3,
CC       CPSF6 and CPSF7. Interacts with CSTF2 and SYMPK.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15109492, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17495927,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24766809}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q7Z6J9:TSEN54; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-2559831, EBI-2559824;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03035,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11060040, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24766810}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q92989-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q92989-2; Sequence=VSP_041164;
CC   -!- DISEASE: Pontocerebellar hypoplasia 10 (PCH10) [MIM:615803]: A
CC       form of pontocerebellar hypoplasia, a disorder characterized by
CC       structural defects of the pons and cerebellum, evident upon brain
CC       imaging. PCH10 features include cortical dysgenesis marked by a
CC       simplified gyral pattern, cortical atrophy, mild or focal
CC       cerebellar vermian volume loss, delayed myelination, progressive
CC       microcephaly, global growth and developmental delays, severe
CC       intellectual disabilities, and seizures refractory to treatment.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24766809, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24766810}.
CC       Note=The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene
CC       represented in this entry. Neurodegeneration is due to defects in
CC       tRNA splicing (PubMed:24766809, PubMed:24766810).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24766809, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24766810}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the Clp1 family. Clp1 subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000255|HAMAP-Rule:MF_03035}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Collagen type III occurs in most soft connective tissues
CC       along with type I collagen. Involved in regulation of cortical
CC       development. Is the major ligand of ADGRG1 in the developing brain
CC       and binding to ADGRG1 inhibits neuronal migration and activates
CC       the RhoA pathway by coupling ADGRG1 to GNA13 and possibly GNA12.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Trimers of identical alpha 1(III) chains. The chains are
CC       linked to each other by interchain disulfide bonds. Trimers are
CC       also cross-linked via hydroxylysines.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O01949:AAEL010235 (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-2431491, EBI-7685554;
CC       P09486:SPARC; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-15740444, EBI-2800983;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted, extracellular space, extracellular
CC       matrix {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00793}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P02461-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P02461-2; Sequence=VSP_022502;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The C-terminal propeptide, also known as COLFI domain,
CC       have crucial roles in tissue growth and repair by controlling both
CC       the intracellular assembly of procollagen molecules and the
CC       extracellular assembly of collagen fibrils. It binds a calcium ion
CC       which is essential for its function.
CC   -!- PTM: Proline residues at the third position of the tripeptide
CC       repeating unit (G-X-Y) are hydroxylated in some or all of the
CC       chains. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:557335, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7016180}.
CC   -!- PTM: O-linked glycan consists of a Glc-Gal disaccharide bound to
CC       the oxygen atom of a post-translationally added hydroxyl group.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, vascular type (EDSVASC)
CC       [MIM:130050]: A severe form of Ehlers-Danlos syndrome, a group of
CC       connective tissue disorders characterized by skin
CC       hyperextensibility, articular hypermobility, and tissue fragility.
CC       EDSVASC is an autosomal dominant disease characterized by joint
CC       and dermal manifestations as in other forms of the syndrome, and
CC       by proneness to spontaneous rupture of bowel and large arteries.
CC       The vascular complications may affect all anatomical areas.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10706896, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10923041,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11168790, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12694234,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12786757, ECO:0000269|PubMed:1352273,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:1357232, ECO:0000269|PubMed:1370809,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:1496983, ECO:0000269|PubMed:1895316,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:2243125, ECO:0000269|PubMed:2349939,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:2492273, ECO:0000269|PubMed:2808425,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:7749417, ECO:0000269|PubMed:7833919,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:7912131, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8019562,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8098182, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8411057,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8514866, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8664902,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8680408, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8884076,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8990011, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9036918,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9147870, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9452103,
CC       ECO:0000269|Ref.46, ECO:0000269|Ref.51}. Note=The disease is
CC       caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the fibrillar collagen family.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00793}.

CC       mutations;

CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Wikipedia; Note=Type-III collagen entry;

RP   VARIANT SER-211.

RL   J. Invest. Dermatol. 129:1650-1655(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Major structural protein of tissues such as aorta and
CC       nuchal ligament, which must expand rapidly and recover completely.
CC       Molecular determinant of the late arterial morphogenesis,
CC       stabilizing arterial structure by regulating proliferation and
CC       organization of vascular smooth muscle (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P54320}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: The polymeric elastin chains are cross-linked together
CC       into an extensible 3D network. Forms a ternary complex with BGN
CC       and MFAP2. Interacts with MFAP2 via divalent cations (calcium >
CC       magnesium > manganese) in a dose-dependent and saturating manner.
CC       Interacts with FBLN5 (PubMed:15790312, PubMed:17035250). Interacts
CC       with FBN1 (PubMed:15790312). Forms a ternary complex with FBN1 and
CC       FBLN2 or FBLN5 (PubMed:17255108). Interacts with MFAP4 in a Ca
CC       (2+)-dependent manner; this interaction promotes ELN self-assembly
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P04985,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15790312, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17035250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17255108}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O95967:EFEMP2; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-1222108, EBI-743414;
CC       Q9UBX5:FBLN5; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1222108, EBI-947897;
CC       P28300:LOX; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-1222108, EBI-3893481;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Secreted, extracellular space, extracellular
CC       matrix {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17035250}. Note=Extracellular matrix of
CC       elastic fibers. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17035250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=13;
CC         Comment=Additional isoforms seem to exist.;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=P15502-3; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P15502-1; Sequence=VSP_012484, VSP_012485, VSP_012487;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P15502-2; Sequence=VSP_012484, VSP_012487;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=P15502-4; Sequence=VSP_012484;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=P15502-5; Sequence=VSP_012481, VSP_012484, VSP_012487,
CC                                  VSP_012488;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=6;
CC         IsoId=P15502-6; Sequence=VSP_012483, VSP_012487, VSP_012488;
CC       Name=7;
CC         IsoId=P15502-7; Sequence=VSP_012479, VSP_012483, VSP_012487,
CC                                  VSP_012488;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=8;
CC         IsoId=P15502-8; Sequence=VSP_012482, VSP_012483, VSP_012486,
CC                                  VSP_012487, VSP_012488;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=9;
CC         IsoId=P15502-9; Sequence=VSP_012485;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=10;
CC         IsoId=P15502-10; Sequence=VSP_012485, VSP_012487;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=11;
CC         IsoId=P15502-11; Sequence=VSP_012480, VSP_012482, VSP_012483,
CC                                   VSP_012487, VSP_012488;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=12;
CC         IsoId=P15502-12; Sequence=VSP_012481, VSP_012483, VSP_012487,
CC                                   VSP_012488;
CC       Name=13;
CC         IsoId=P15502-13; Sequence=VSP_012483, VSP_012487;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed within the outer myometrial smooth
CC       muscle and throughout the arteriolar tree of uterus (at protein
CC       level). Also expressed in the large arteries, lung and skin.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8812460}.
CC   -!- PTM: Elastin is formed through the cross-linking of its soluble
CC       precursor tropoelastin. Cross-linking is initiated through the
CC       action of lysyl oxidase on exposed lysines to form allysine.
CC       Subsequent spontaneous condensation reactions with other allysine
CC       or unmodified lysine residues result in various bi-, tri-, and
CC       tetrafunctional cross-links. The most abundant cross-links in
CC       mature elastin fibers are lysinonorleucine, allysine aldol,
CC       desmosine, and isodesmosine.
CC   -!- PTM: Hydroxylation on proline residues within the sequence motif,
CC       GXPG, is most likely 4-hydroxy as this fits the requirement for 4-
CC       hydroxylation in vertebrates. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Cutis laxa, autosomal dominant, 1 (ADCL1) [MIM:123700]: A
CC       connective tissue disorder characterized by loose, hyperextensible
CC       skin with decreased resilience and elasticity leading to a
CC       premature aged appearance. Face, hands, feet, joints, and torso
CC       may be differentially affected. Additional variable clinical
CC       features are gastrointestinal diverticula, hernia, and genital
CC       prolapse. Rare manifestations are pulmonary artery stenosis,
CC       aortic aneurysm, bronchiectasis, and emphysema.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9873040}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Supravalvular aortic stenosis (SVAS) [MIM:185500]:
CC       Congenital narrowing of the ascending aorta which can occur
CC       sporadically, as an autosomal dominant condition, or as one
CC       component of Williams-Beuren syndrome.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10942104}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=ELN is located in the Williams-Beuren syndrome (WBS)
CC       critical region. WBS results from a hemizygous deletion of several
CC       genes on chromosome 7q11.23, thought to arise as a consequence of
CC       unequal crossing over between highly homologous low-copy repeat
CC       sequences flanking the deleted region. Haploinsufficiency of ELN
CC       may be the cause of certain cardiovascular and musculo-skeletal
CC       abnormalities observed in the disease (PubMed:8812460).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:8812460}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the elastin family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=CAD98065.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally shortened.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC       URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elastin";

RN   [27]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.61 ANGSTROMS) OF 1-300, FUNCTION, SUBUNIT,
RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, DOMAIN F-BAR, COILED-COIL DOMAIN, AND
RP   MUTAGENESIS OF LYS-33; THR-165; LYS-166; ASP-168 AND PRO-210.
RX   PubMed=17512409; DOI=10.1016/j.cell.2007.03.040;
RA   Shimada A., Niwa H., Tsujita K., Suetsugu S., Nitta K.,
RA   Hanawa-Suetsugu K., Akasaka R., Nishino Y., Toyama M., Chen L.,
RA   Liu Z.-J., Wang B.C., Yamamoto M., Terada T., Miyazawa A., Tanaka A.,
RA   Sugano S., Shirouzu M., Nagayama K., Takenawa T., Yokoyama S.;
RT   "Curved EFC/F-BAR-domain dimers are joined end to end into a filament
RT   for membrane invagination in endocytosis.";
RL   Cell 129:761-772(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: May act as a link between RND2 signaling and regulation
CC       of the actin cytoskeleton (By similarity). Required to coordinate
CC       membrane tubulation with reorganization of the actin cytoskeleton
CC       during the late stage of clathrin-mediated endocytosis. Binds to
CC       lipids such as phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate and
CC       phosphatidylserine and promotes membrane invagination and the
CC       formation of tubules. Also enhances actin polymerization via the
CC       recruitment of WASL/N-WASP, which in turn activates the Arp2/3
CC       complex. Actin polymerization may promote the fission of membrane
CC       tubules to form endocytic vesicles. May be required for the
CC       lysosomal retention of FASLG/FASL. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15252009, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16318909,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16326391, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16418535,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17512409}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts specifically with GTP-bound RND2 and CDC42.
CC       Interacts with PDE6G and microtubules (By similarity).
CC       Homodimerizes, the dimers can polymerize end-to-end to form
CC       filamentous structures. Interacts with AKAP9, ARHGAP17, DAAM1,
CC       DIAPH1, DIAPH2, DNM1, DNM2, DNM3, FASLG/FASL, SNX2 and WASL/N-
CC       WASP. May interact with TNKS. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11431473, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11438682,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12023017, ECO:0000269|PubMed:14596906,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15047863, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15252009,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16318909, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16326391,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16418535, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16630611,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17512409}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Self; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-1111248, EBI-1111248;
CC       Q05193:DNM1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-1111248, EBI-713135;
CC       P48023:FASLG; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-1111248, EBI-495538;
CC       O95166:GABARAP; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-1111248, EBI-712001;
CC       P97573:Inpp5d (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-1111248, EBI-8008869;
CC       O60749:SNX2; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-1111248, EBI-1046690;
CC       O95271:TNKS; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-1111248, EBI-1105254;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton.
CC       Cytoplasm, cell cortex. Lysosome. Cytoplasmic vesicle. Cell
CC       membrane; Peripheral membrane protein; Cytoplasmic side. Membrane,
CC       clathrin-coated pit. Note=Enriched in cortical regions coincident
CC       with F-actin. Also localizes to endocytic vesicles and lysosomes.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=5;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q96RU3-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q96RU3-2; Sequence=VSP_021695, VSP_021696;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q96RU3-3; Sequence=VSP_021694, VSP_021696;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=Q96RU3-4; Sequence=VSP_021693;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=Q96RU3-5; Sequence=VSP_021695;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Very highly expressed in the epithelial cells
CC       of the gastrointestinal tract, respiratory, reproductive and
CC       urinary systems. Also highly expressed in brown adipose tissue,
CC       cardiomyocytes, enteric ganglia and glucagon producing cells of
CC       the pancreas. Expressed in germ cells of the testis and all
CC       regions of the brain. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11438682,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15252009}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The F-BAR domain binds the phospholipid membrane with its
CC       concave surface. The end-to-end polymerization of dimers of these
CC       domains provides a curved surface that fits best membranes with
CC       around 600 A diameter, and may drive tubulation.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17512409}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=A chromosomal aberration involving FNBP1 is found in
CC       acute leukemias. Translocation t(9;11)(q34;q23) with KMT2A/MLL1.
CC       The relatively low incidence of the KMT2A/MLL1-FNBP1 fusion
CC       protein in acute leukemia may reflect the marginal capacity of
CC       this fusion protein to induce cellular transformation.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the FNBP1 family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in the de novo synthesis of guanine nucleotides
CC       which are not only essential for DNA and RNA synthesis, but also
CC       provide GTP, which is involved in a number of cellular processes
CC       important for cell division.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY:
CC       Reaction=ATP + H2O + L-glutamine + XMP = AMP + diphosphate + GMP +
CC         2 H(+) + L-glutamate; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:11680, ChEBI:CHEBI:15377,
CC         ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:29985, ChEBI:CHEBI:30616,
CC         ChEBI:CHEBI:33019, ChEBI:CHEBI:57464, ChEBI:CHEBI:58115,
CC         ChEBI:CHEBI:58359, ChEBI:CHEBI:456215; EC=6.3.5.2;
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Purine metabolism; GMP biosynthesis; GMP from XMP (L-Gln
CC       route): step 1/1.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23816837}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P49915-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P49915-2; Sequence=VSP_053933;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=A chromosomal aberration involving GMPS is found in
CC       acute myeloid leukemias. Translocation t(3,11)(q25,q23) with
CC       KMT2A/MLL1.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Acts as a transcriptional corepressor of orphan nuclear
CC       receptor NR2C2 (PubMed:15302918). Inhibits expression of the
CC       gluconeogenesis enzyme PCK2 through inhibition of NR2C2 activity
CC       (By similarity). Also involved in transcriptional activation of
CC       NAMPT by promoting expression of PPARA and PPARD (By similarity).
CC       Plays a role in lipid metabolism by suppressing lipogenesis,
CC       increasing lipolysis and decreasing lipid accumulation in adipose
CC       tissue (By similarity). Plays a role in glucose homeostasis by
CC       improving glucose metabolism and insulin sensitivity (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q80ZQ5,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15302918}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with NR2C2 (via ligand-binding region).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15302918}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P49116:NR2C2; NbExp=6; IntAct=EBI-11023753, EBI-2652582;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15302918}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q86VZ6-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q86VZ6-2; Sequence=VSP_007755;
CC         Note=Incomplete sequence. No experimental confirmation
CC         available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highest expression in testis with moderate
CC       levels in colon, placenta, prostate and ovary and low levels in
CC       brain, spleen, liver and small intestine.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15302918}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=A chromosomal aberration involving JAZF1 may be a
CC       cause of endometrial stromal tumors. Translocation
CC       t(7;17)(p15;q21) with SUZ12. The translocation generates the
CC       JAZF1-SUZ12 oncogene consisting of the N-terminus part of JAZF1
CC       and the C-terminus part of SUZ12. It is frequently found in all
CC       cases of endometrial stromal tumors, except in endometrial stromal
CC       sarcomas, where it is rarer. Translocation t(6;7)(p21;p22) with
CC       PHF1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11371647, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16397222}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Under hypoxic conditions, the precursor SUZ12 RNA
CC       undergoes regulated trans-splicing with the JAZF1 RNA, resulting
CC       in a chimeric isoform which may be protective against apoptosis.
CC       The chimeric transcript is characterized by JAZF1 exons 1-3 joined
CC       to SUZ12 exon 2-16. The chimeric transcript is expressed primarily
CC       in the endometrium from late secretory and early proliferative
CC       phases of the menstrual cycle, but not in normal myometrium at any
CC       phase of the cycle. Its expression is slightly induced by low
CC       levels of progesterone, but suppressed by both estrogen and high
CC       levels of progesterone (PubMed:18772439).
CC       {ECO:0000305|PubMed:18772439}.
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology
CC       and Haematology;
CC       URL="http://atlasgeneticsoncology.org/Genes/JAZF1ID41036ch7p15.html";

RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=24275569; DOI=10.1016/j.jprot.2013.11.014;
RA   Bian Y., Song C., Cheng K., Dong M., Wang F., Huang J., Sun D.,

RT   "An enzyme assisted RP-RPLC approach for in-depth analysis of human
RT   liver phosphoproteome.";
RL   J. Proteomics 96:253-262(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in the generation of internal asymmetric
CC       signals required for neuronal polarization and neurite outgrowth.
CC       Mediates netrin-1-induced F-actin-substrate coupling or 'clutch
CC       engagement' within the axon growth cone through activation of
CC       CDC42, RAC1 and PAK1-dependent signaling pathway, thereby
CC       converting the F-actin retrograde flow into traction forces,
CC       concomitantly with filopodium extension and axon outgrowth. Plays
CC       a role in cytoskeletal organization by regulating the subcellular
CC       localization of phosphoinositide 3-kinase (PI3K) activity at the
CC       axonal growth cone. Plays also a role in regenerative neurite
CC       outgrowth. In the developing cortex, cooperates with KIF20B to
CC       promote both the transition from the multipolar to the bipolar
CC       stage and the radial migration of cortical neurons from the
CC       ventricular zone toward the superficial layer of the neocortex.
CC       Involved in the accumulation of phosphatidylinositol 3,4,5-
CC       trisphosphate (PIP3) in the growth cone of primary hippocampal
CC       neurons. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:A0MZ67,
CC       ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8K2Q9}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with L1CAM; this interaction occurs in axonal
CC       growth cones. Interacts with actin filament retrograde flow; this
CC       interaction is enhanced in a netrin-1- and PAK1-dependent manner
CC       and promotes F-actin-substrate coupling and concomitant formation
CC       of traction forces at axonal growth cones. Interacts with RUFY3.
CC       Interacts with PFN2. Interacts (via N-terminus) with KIF20B; this
CC       interaction is direct and promotes the association of SHTN1 to
CC       microtubules in primary neurons. Associates with microtubule.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:A0MZ67, ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8K2Q9}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O75936:BBOX1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-10171490, EBI-715662;
CC       P62508:ESRRG; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-308778, EBI-2834260;
CC       P05413:FABP3; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-308778, EBI-704216;
CC       Q6PJR7:IGL@; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-308778, EBI-10254102;
CC       Q9Y5B8:NME7; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-308778, EBI-744782;
CC       Q12800:TFCP2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-10171490, EBI-717422;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Perikaryon {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8K2Q9}.
CC       Cell projection, axon {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8K2Q9}. Cell
CC       projection, growth cone {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8K2Q9}. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8K2Q9}. Cell projection,
CC       filopodium {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:A0MZ67}. Cell projection,
CC       lamellipodium {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:A0MZ67}. Note=Localizes in
CC       multiple growth cones at neurite tips before the neuronal
CC       symmetry-breaking step. Accumulates in growth cones of a single
CC       nascent axon in a neurite length-dependent manner during the
CC       neuronal symmetry-breaking step; when absent from the nascent
CC       axon's siblings, probably due to competitive transport, prevents
CC       the formation of surplus axons. Transported anterogradely from the
CC       soma to the axon growth cone in an actin and myosin-dependent
CC       manner and passively diffuses back to the cell bodies. Colocalized
CC       with L1CAM in close apposition with actin filaments in filopodia
CC       and lamellipodia of axonal growth cones in hippocampal neurons.
CC       Exhibits retrograde movements in filopodia and lamellopodia of
CC       axonal growth cones. Colocalized with KIF20B along microtubules to
CC       the tip of the growing cone in primary hippocampal neurons.
CC       Recruted to the growth cone of developing axon in a KIF20B- and
CC       microtubule-dependent manner. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:A0MZ67,
CC       ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8K2Q9}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=8;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=A0MZ66-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=A0MZ66-2; Sequence=VSP_027050, VSP_027051;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=A0MZ66-3; Sequence=VSP_027053;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=4;
CC         IsoId=A0MZ66-4; Sequence=VSP_027052;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=A0MZ66-5; Sequence=VSP_036498;
CC       Name=6;
CC         IsoId=A0MZ66-6; Sequence=VSP_036499;
CC       Name=7;
CC         IsoId=A0MZ66-7; Sequence=VSP_036497;
CC       Name=8;
CC         IsoId=A0MZ66-8; Sequence=VSP_036498, VSP_027052;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The N-terminus region is necessary for interaction with
CC       actin retrograde filament flow and accumulation in neuronal growth
CC       cones. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:A0MZ67}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on Ser-101 and Ser-249 by PAK1 through a
CC       CDC42- and RAC1-dependent signaling pathway, which enhances its
CC       association with F-actin retrograde flow in filopodia and
CC       lamellipodia of axonal growth cones. Phosphorylation on Ser-101
CC       and Ser-249 is increased by netrin-1.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:A0MZ67}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the shootin family. {ECO:0000305}.

RG   UK10K;
RA   Rainger J., Williamson K.A., Soares D.C., Truch J., Kurian D.,
RA   Gillessen-Kaesbach G., Seawright A., Prendergast J., Halachev M.,

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Actin-binding protein (PubMed:16636079, PubMed:17294403,
CC       PubMed:28493397). Plays a role in the activation of T-cells in
CC       response to costimulation through TCR/CD3 and CD2 or CD28
CC       (PubMed:17294403). Modulates the cell surface expression of
CC       IL2RA/CD25 and CD69 (PubMed:17294403).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16636079, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17294403,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:28493397}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. Interacts with AIF1 (By similarity). Interacts
CC       with actin (PubMed:28493397). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q61233,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16636079, ECO:0000269|PubMed:28493397}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16636079}. Cell junction
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17294403}. Cell projection
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16636079}. Cell projection, ruffle membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q61233, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16636079};
CC       Peripheral membrane protein {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q61233};
CC       Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q61233}. Note=Relocalizes
CC       to the immunological synapse between peripheral blood T-
CC       lymphocytes and antibody-presenting cells in response to
CC       costimulation through TCR/CD3 and CD2 or CD28 (PubMed:17294403).
CC       Associated with the actin cytoskeleton at membrane ruffles.
CC       Relocalizes to actin-rich cell projections upon serine
CC       phosphorylation (PubMed:16636079). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q61233,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16636079, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17294403}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P13796-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P13796-2; Sequence=VSP_056450, VSP_056451;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Detected in intestinal microvilli, hair cell
CC       stereocilia, and fibroblast filopodia, in spleen and other lymph
CC       node-containing organs. Expressed in peripheral blood T-
CC       lymphocytes, neutrophils, monocytes, B-lymphocytes, and myeloid
CC       cells. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:3261603}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on a serine residue in response to
CC       costimulation through TCR/CD3 and CD2 or CD28. Serine
CC       phosphorylation promotes association with the actin cytoskeleton
CC       and targeting to peripheral cell projections.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16636079, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17294403}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=Chromosomal aberrations involving LCP1 is a cause of
CC       B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphomas (B-cell NHL). Translocation
CC       t(3;13)(q27;q14), with BCL6. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10469447}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=Defects in LCP1 has been found in a patient with
CC       isolated coloboma, a defect of the eye characterized by the
CC       absence of ocular structures due to abnormal morphogenesis of the
CC       optic cup and stalk, and the fusion of the fetal fissure (optic
CC       fissure). Isolated colobomas may be associated with an abnormally
CC       small eye (microphthalmia) or small cornea.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:28493397}.
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology
CC       and Haematology;
CC       URL="http://atlasgeneticsoncology.org/Genes/LCP1ID95.html";

CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in lymphoid and pancreatic tissues.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Currarino syndrome (CURRAS) [MIM:176450]: The triad of a
CC       presacral tumor, sacral agenesis and anorectal malformation
CC       constitutes the Currarino syndrome which is caused by dorsal-
CC       ventral patterning defects during embryonic development. The
CC       syndrome occurs in the majority of patients as an autosomal
CC       dominant trait. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10631160,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10749657, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19853743,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22820079}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Cardiac- and muscle-specific transcription factor. May
CC       act to regulate the expression of genes involved in the
CC       development of myotubes. Plays a critical role in ventricular
CC       cardiomyocyte expansion and regulates postnatal skeletal muscle
CC       growth and regeneration. Involved in the organized assembly of
CC       thick and thin filaments of myofibril sarcomeres (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P70670}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts (via PXLXP motif) with the muscle-restricted
CC       histone methyltransferase SMYD1 (via MYND-type zinc finger).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P70670}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P70670}.
CC       Nucleus {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P70670}.

RN   [36]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.5 ANGSTROMS) OF 84-136, SUBUNIT,
RP   DNA/RNA-BINDING REGION, AND SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=20214399; DOI=10.1021/bi902050p;
RA   Liu Y., Hu Y., Li X., Niu L., Teng M.;
RT   "The crystal structure of the human nascent polypeptide-associated
RT   complex domain reveals a nucleic acid-binding region on the NACA
RT   subunit.";
RL   Biochemistry 49:2890-2896(2010).
RN   [37]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.9 ANGSTROMS) OF 79-132, AND SUBUNIT.
RX   PubMed=21203952; DOI=10.1007/s13238-010-0049-3;
RA   Wang L., Zhang W., Wang L., Zhang X.C., Li X., Rao Z.;
RT   "Crystal structures of NAC domains of human nascent polypeptide-
RT   associated complex (NAC) and its alphaNAC subunit.";
RL   Protein Cell 1:406-416(2010).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Prevents inappropriate targeting of non-secretory
CC       polypeptides to the endoplasmic reticulum (ER). Binds to nascent
CC       polypeptide chains as they emerge from the ribosome and blocks
CC       their interaction with the signal recognition particle (SRP),
CC       which normally targets nascent secretory peptides to the ER. Also
CC       reduces the inherent affinity of ribosomes for protein
CC       translocation sites in the ER membrane (M sites). May act as a
CC       specific coactivator for JUN, binding to DNA and stabilizing the
CC       interaction of JUN homodimers with target gene promoters.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10982809, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15784678,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9877153}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with TBP and JUN (By similarity). Part of the
CC       nascent polypeptide-associated complex (NAC), which is a
CC       heterodimer of NACA and BTF3 (via NAC-A/B domains). NAC associates
CC       with ribosomes through the BTF3/NACB subunit and contacts the
CC       ribosomal protein L23, which is positioned near the exiting site.
CC       Both subunits can contact nascent polypeptide chains. NACA may
CC       also form homodimers, and only this form binds DNA. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10982809, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12684039,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20214399, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21203952}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P40222:TXLNA; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-712216, EBI-359793;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm. Nucleus. Note=The heterodimer is
CC       located mainly in the cytosol, and the homodimer in the nucleus.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q13765-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=skNAC-2; Synonyms=2;
CC         IsoId=E9PAV3-2; Sequence=External;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=skNAC;
CC         IsoId=E9PAV3-1; Sequence=External;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitously expressed.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16201836}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The positively charged inner surface of the NAC-A/B domain
CC       is crucial for NACA localization in the nucleus and DNA-binding.
CC       This region is blocked from binding nucleic acids in the
CC       heterodimeric complex by a helix region in the beta-subunit, it
CC       also displays much higher affinity for RNA than DNA.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylation of Thr-159 by GSK3B may promote proteasome
CC       mediated degradation (By similarity). Phosphorylation of Ser-43 by
CC       ILK during cell adhesion may promote nuclear localization.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15299025, ECO:0000269|Ref.13}.
CC   -!- ALLERGEN: Causes an allergic reaction in human. Binds to IgE from
CC       atopic dermatitis (AD) patients. Identified as an IgE autoantigen
CC       in atopic dermatitis (AD) patients with severe skin
CC       manifestations. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:9806765}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the NAC-alpha family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAV83778.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Has an important role in stress fiber formation induced
CC       by active diaphanous protein homolog 1 (DRF1). Induces microspike
CC       formation, in vivo (By similarity). In vitro, stimulates N-WASP-
CC       induced ARP2/3 complex activation in the absence of CDC42 (By
CC       similarity). May play an important role in the maintenance of
CC       sarcomeres and/or in the assembly of myofibrils into sarcomeres.
CC       Implicated in regulation of actin polymerization and cell
CC       adhesion. Plays a role in angiogenesis. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22419821}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Associates with the intermediate filaments, vimentin and
CC       desmin. Binds the first and third SH3 domains of NCK. Binds the
CC       proline-rich domains of N-WASP through its SH3 domain (By
CC       similarity). Similarly, binds diaphanous protein homolog 1 (DRF1).
CC       Binds the SH3 domains of GRB2 through its proline-rich domains.
CC       Interacts with Helicobacter pylori toxin vacA. Isoform 4 interacts
CC       with FHOD1. Interacts with FASLG. Interacts with TMIGD2.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10619843,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15095401, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19807924,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22419821}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q60437:BAIAP2 (xeno); NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-745080, EBI-7010040;
CC       Q9UQB8:BAIAP2; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-745080, EBI-525456;
CC       P06241:FYN; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-745080, EBI-515315;
CC       Q9Z0W5:Pacsin1 (xeno); NbExp=6; IntAct=EBI-745080, EBI-1550185;
CC       Q9QY17:Pacsin2 (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-745080, EBI-491201;
CC       O00233:PSMD9; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-745080, EBI-750973;
CC       O60504:SORBS3; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-745080, EBI-741237;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Note=Colocalizes with DRF1 at
CC       membrane ruffles, and with Nck at Z-disks in mature cardiac
CC       myocytes.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=5;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9NZQ3-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9NZQ3-2; Sequence=VSP_003971;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q9NZQ3-3; Sequence=VSP_039422;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=4; Synonyms=WISH-B;
CC         IsoId=Q9NZQ3-4; Sequence=VSP_039422, VSP_039425, VSP_039426;
CC       Name=5;
CC         IsoId=Q9NZQ3-5; Sequence=VSP_039423, VSP_039424;
CC         Note=Found in a brain affected by Alzheimer disease. May be due
CC         to intron retention. No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highest expression in heart, brain, skeletal
CC       muscle, kidney and liver. Lower levels in placenta, lung, small
CC       intestine and leukocytes. Weak expression in colon, thymus and
CC       spleen. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10619843}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=A chromosomal aberration involving NCKIPSD/AF3p21 is
CC       found in therapy-related leukemia. Translocation t(3;11)(p21;q23)
CC       with KMT2A/MLL1. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10648423}.

CC       function in binding of osteoblasts via the alpha(V)beta(3)-
CC       integrin (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.

CC       matrix {ECO:0000250}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Stimulates the dissociation of GDP from the Ras-related
CC       RalA and RalB GTPases which allows GTP binding and activation of
CC       the GTPases. Interacts and acts as an effector molecule for R-Ras,
CC       H-Ras, K-Ras, and Rap.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with RIT1 and RIT2. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P01112:HRAS; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-365861, EBI-350145;
CC       P61224:RAP1B; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-365861, EBI-358143;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q03385}.
CC       Nucleus {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q03385}. Note=Localizes mainly in
CC       the peripheral region of the cytoplasmic membrane in oocytes and
CC       in preimplantation embryos until the 8-cell stage. Between the
CC       late 1-cell and the early 2-cell stages, nuclear localization
CC       becomes stronger. After the 4-cell stage, not detected in the
CC       nucleus. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q03385}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Filament-forming cytoskeletal GTPase (By similarity).
CC       May play a role in cytokinesis (Potential). May play a role in
CC       platelet secretion (By similarity). {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Septins polymerize into heterooligomeric protein
CC       complexes that form filaments, and can associate with cellular
CC       membranes, actin filaments and microtubules. GTPase activity is
CC       required for filament formation (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       SEPT2 and SEPT5. In platelets, associated with a complex
CC       containing STX4. Interacts with PRKN. This interaction leads to
CC       SEPT5 ubiquitination and degradation (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q8WYJ6:SEPT1; NbExp=9; IntAct=EBI-373345, EBI-693002;
CC       B5ME97:SEPT10; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-373345, EBI-10176098;
CC       Q9P0V9:SEPT10; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-373345, EBI-3943788;
CC       Q9NVA2:SEPT11; NbExp=9; IntAct=EBI-373345, EBI-957999;
CC       Q15019:SEPT2; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-373345, EBI-741220;
CC       Q14141:SEPT6; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-373345, EBI-745901;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton {ECO:0000250}. Note=In platelets, found in areas
CC       surrounding alpha-granules.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q99719-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q99719-2; Sequence=VSP_042689, VSP_042690;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed at high levels in the CNS, as well
CC       as in heart and platelets (at protein level).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12023038, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15915442}.
CC   -!- PTM: In platelets, phosphorylated in response to thrombin,
CC       phorbol-12-myristate-13-acetate and collagen.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11880646}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: In a heterologous system, SEPT5 overexpression has
CC       been shown to exert dopamine-dependent neurotoxicity. As wild-type
CC       PRKN, but not familial-linked PRKN mutants, ubiquitinates mouse
CC       SEPT5 and promotes its degradation, it has been suggested that a
CC       deficiency in SEPT5 degradation may contribute to the development
CC       of early onset Parkinson disease 2 (PARK2).
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TRAFAC class TrmE-Era-EngA-EngB-Septin-
CC       like GTPase superfamily. Septin GTPase family.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01056}.

CC       and Haematology;

RN   [22]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (4.0 ANGSTROMS) OF 1-427 IN COMPLEX WITH GTP,
RP   ELECTRON MICROSCOPY OF SEPTIN COMPLEX, AND SUBUNIT.
RX   PubMed=17637674; DOI=10.1038/nature06052;
RA   Sirajuddin M., Farkasovsky M., Hauer F., Kuehlmann D., Macara I.G.,
RA   Weyand M., Stark H., Wittinghofer A.;
RT   "Structural insight into filament formation by mammalian septins.";
RL   Nature 449:311-315(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Filament-forming cytoskeletal GTPase. Required for
CC       normal organization of the actin cytoskeleton. Involved in
CC       cytokinesis. May play a role in HCV RNA replication. Forms a
CC       filamentous structure with SEPT12, SEPT6, SEPT2 and probably SEPT4
CC       at the sperm annulus which is required for the structural
CC       integrity and motility of the sperm tail during postmeiotic
CC       differentiation (PubMed:25588830). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17229681,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17803907, ECO:0000305|PubMed:25588830}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Septins polymerize into heterooligomeric protein
CC       complexes that form filaments, and associate with cellular
CC       membranes, actin filaments and microtubules. GTPase activity is
CC       required for filament formation. Filaments are assembled from
CC       asymmetrical heterotrimers, composed of SEPT2, SEPT6 and SEPT7
CC       that associate head-to-head to form a hexameric unit. Within the
CC       trimer, directly interacts with SEPT2 and SEPT7. Also interacts
CC       with SEPT9 and SEPT12. Interaction with SEPT12 alters filament
CC       structure. Component of a septin core octomeric complex consisting
CC       of SEPT12, SEPT7, SEPT6 and SEPT2 or SEPT4 in the order 12-7-6-2-
CC       2-6-7-12 or 12-7-6-4-4-6-7-12 and located in the sperm annulus.
CC       Interacts with SOCS7. Interacts with HNRNPA1.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16914550, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17229681,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17637674, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17803907,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18047794, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19145258,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:25588830}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: (Microbial infection) Interacts with HCV NS5B.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17229681}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P27958:- (xeno); NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-6904388;
CC       P09651:HNRNPA1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-352662;
CC       Q8NDC4:MORN4; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-10269566;
CC       Q9H8W4:PLEKHF2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-742388;
CC       Q8WYJ6:SEPT1; NbExp=6; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-693002;
CC       Q8IYM1:SEPT12; NbExp=14; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-2585067;
CC       Q15019:SEPT2; NbExp=10; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-741220;
CC       Q9UH03:SEPT3; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-727037;
CC       Q99719:SEPT5; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-373345;
CC       Q16181:SEPT7; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-2009373;
CC       A0A0S2Z5W9:SEPT9; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-16437910;
CC       Q9UHD8:SEPT9; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-851542;
CC       O14512-1:SOCS7; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-745901, EBI-1539617;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15774761}.
CC       Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, spindle {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15774761}.
CC       Chromosome, centromere, kinetochore {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15774761}.
CC       Cleavage furrow {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15774761}. Midbody
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15774761}. Cell projection, cilium, flagellum
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25588830}. Note=In metaphase cells, localized
CC       within the microtubule spindle. At the metaphase plate, in close
CC       apposition to the kinetochores of the congressed chromosomes. In
CC       cells undergoing cytokinesis, localized to the midbody, the
CC       ingressing cleavage furrow, and the central spindle. Found in the
CC       sperm annulus (PubMed:25588830). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:25588830}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=4;
CC       Name=II;
CC         IsoId=Q14141-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=I; Synonyms=III;
CC         IsoId=Q14141-2; Sequence=VSP_006053;
CC       Name=IV;
CC         IsoId=Q14141-3; Sequence=VSP_006051, VSP_006052;
CC       Name=V;
CC         IsoId=Q14141-4; Sequence=VSP_006054;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15915442}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Coordinated expression with SEPT2 and SEPT7.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Filament-forming cytoskeletal GTPase (By similarity).
CC       May play a role in cytokinesis (Potential). May play a role in the
CC       internalization of 2 intracellular microbial pathogens, Listeria
CC       monocytogenes and Shigella flexneri. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Septins polymerize into heterooligomeric protein
CC       complexes that form filaments, and associate with cellular
CC       membranes, actin filaments, and microtubules. GTPase activity is
CC       required for filament formation. Interacts with SEPT2, SEPT6,
CC       SEPT7, SEPT11 and SEPT14. Interacts with RTKN and ARHGEF18. In a
CC       mesenchymal cell line, Rho/RTKN signals cause disruption of wild-
CC       type septin filaments, but not of those containing isoform 2
CC       variants HNA Trp-106 and Phe-111. In a mesenchymal cell line,
CC       isoform 2 variants HNA Trp-106 and Phe-111, but not wild type,
CC       form filaments with SEPT4. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15485874,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15558029, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16007136,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17546647, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17922164,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19145258}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q16665:HIF1A; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-851558, EBI-447269;
CC       Q6ZU15:SEPT14; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-851558, EBI-2009297;
CC       Q14141:SEPT6; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-851542, EBI-745901;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17546647, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17922164}.
CC       Note=In an epithelial cell line, concentrates at cell-cell contact
CC       areas. After TGF-beta1 treatment and induction of epithelial to
CC       mesenchymal transition, colocalizes partly with actin stress
CC       fibers. During bacterial infection, displays a collar shape
CC       structure next to actin at the pole of invading bacteria.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=8;
CC         Comment=There are potentially 18 isoforms.;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Epsilon, MSF-A;
CC         IsoId=Q9UHD8-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Alpha;
CC         IsoId=Q9UHD8-2; Sequence=VSP_012337;
CC       Name=3; Synonyms=Beta, MSF-B;
CC         IsoId=Q9UHD8-3; Sequence=VSP_012336;
CC         Note=Contains a N-acetylmethionine at position 1.
CC         {ECO:0000244|PubMed:22814378};
CC       Name=4; Synonyms=Delta;
CC         IsoId=Q9UHD8-4; Sequence=VSP_012335;
CC       Name=5; Synonyms=Gamma;
CC         IsoId=Q9UHD8-5; Sequence=VSP_012338;
CC       Name=7;
CC         IsoId=Q9UHD8-7; Sequence=VSP_038317;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=8;
CC         IsoId=Q9UHD8-8; Sequence=VSP_038316, VSP_038318;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC       Name=9;
CC         IsoId=Q9UHD8-9; Sequence=VSP_038315, VSP_038319;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed. Isoforms are differentially
CC       expressed in testes, kidney, liver heart, spleen, brain,
CC       peripheral blood leukocytes, skeletal muscle and kidney. Specific
CC       isoforms appear to demonstrate tissue specificity. Isoform 5 is
CC       the most highly expressed in fetal tissue. Isoform 1 is detected
CC       in all tissues except the brain and thymus, while isoform 2,
CC       isoform 3, and isoform 4 are detected at low levels in
CC       approximately half of the fetal tissues.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10339604, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10673329,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11593400, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15915442}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=A chromosomal aberration involving SEPT9/MSF is
CC       found in therapy-related acute myeloid leukemia (t-AML).
CC       Translocation t(11;17)(q23;q25) with KMT2A/MLL1.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10339604}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Hereditary neuralgic amyotrophy (HNA) [MIM:162100]:
CC       Autosomal dominant form of recurrent focal neuropathy
CC       characterized clinically by acute, recurrent episodes of brachial
CC       plexus neuropathy with muscle weakness and atrophy preceded by
CC       severe pain in the affected arm. HNA is triggered by environmental
CC       factors such as infection or parturition.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16186812, ECO:0000269|PubMed:17546647,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18492087, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19451530}.
CC       Note=The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene
CC       represented in this entry.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TRAFAC class TrmE-Era-EngA-EngB-Septin-
CC       like GTPase superfamily. Septin GTPase family.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01056}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAB14057.1; Type=Miscellaneous discrepancy; Note=Aberrant splicing.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: GTPase-activating protein for RAC1 and perhaps Cdc42,
CC       but not for RhoA small GTPase. May attenuate RAC1 signaling in
CC       neurons. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12195014,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12447388}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer (Probable). Forms a heterooligomer with SRGAP1
CC       and SRGAP2 through its F-BAR domain. Interacts with WASF1.
CC       Probably interacts with ROBO1. Interacts with FASLG.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11672528, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12447388,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19807924, ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O08838:Amph (xeno); NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-368166, EBI-80080;
CC       P62993:GRB2; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-368166, EBI-401755;
CC       P42858:HTT; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-368166, EBI-466029;
CC       O35964:Sh3gl1 (xeno); NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-368166, EBI-1149235;
CC       O35179:Sh3gl2 (xeno); NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-368166, EBI-1149197;
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=MEGAPa, srGAP3a;
CC         IsoId=O43295-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=MEGAPb, srGAP3b;
CC         IsoId=O43295-2; Sequence=VSP_010581;
CC       Name=3; Synonyms=MEGAPc, srGAP3c;
CC         IsoId=O43295-3; Sequence=VSP_010582, VSP_010583;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in adult and fetal brain.
CC       Expressed at low levels in kidney. Isoform 3 is expressed in the
CC       kidney but is absent in the brain. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12195014,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12447388}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The F-BAR domain mediates oligomerization, binds
CC       membranes, and induces plasma membrane protrusions.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Note=A chromosomal aberration involving SRGAP3 is found
CC       in a patient with severe idiopathic mental retardation
CC       (PubMed:12195014). Translocation t(X;3)(p11.2;p25)
CC       (PubMed:12195014). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12195014}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Appears to promote apoptosis in a p53/TP53-independent
CC       manner.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Putative regulatory component of the chromatin
CC       remodeling INO80 complex which is involved in transcriptional
CC       regulation, DNA replication and probably DNA repair.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with NOL3; translocates NOL3 into the nucleus
CC       and negatively regulated TFPT-induced cell death (By similarity).
CC       Component of the chromatin remodeling INO80 complex; specifically
CC       part of a complex module associated with the N-terminus of INO80.
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9JMG6,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:16230350, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18922472,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21303910}.

RN   [43]
RP   INVOLVEMENT IN IMD46, VARIANT IMD46 HIS-20, CHARACTERIZATION OF
RP   VARIANT IMD46 HIS-20, FUNCTION, AND INTERACTION WITH STEAP3.
RX   PubMed=26642240; DOI=10.1038/ng.3465;
RA   Jabara H.H., Boyden S.E., Chou J., Ramesh N., Massaad M.J., Benson H.,
RA   Bainter W., Fraulino D., Rahimov F., Sieff C., Liu Z.J.,
RA   Alshemmari S.H., Al-Ramadi B.K., Al-Dhekri H., Arnaout R.,
RA   Abu-Shukair M., Vatsayan A., Silver E., Ahuja S., Davies E.G.,
RA   Sola-Visner M., Ohsumi T.K., Andrews N.C., Notarangelo L.D.,
RA   Fleming M.D., Al-Herz W., Kunkel L.M., Geha R.S.;
RT   "A missense mutation in TFRC, encoding transferrin receptor 1, causes
RT   combined immunodeficiency.";
RL   Nat. Genet. 48:74-78(2016).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Cellular uptake of iron occurs via receptor-mediated
CC       endocytosis of ligand-occupied transferrin receptor into
CC       specialized endosomes. Endosomal acidification leads to iron
CC       release. The apotransferrin-receptor complex is then recycled to
CC       the cell surface with a return to neutral pH and the concomitant
CC       loss of affinity of apotransferrin for its receptor. Transferrin
CC       receptor is necessary for development of erythrocytes and the
CC       nervous system (By similarity). A second ligand, the heditary
CC       hemochromatosis protein HFE, competes for binding with transferrin
CC       for an overlapping C-terminal binding site. Positively regulates T
CC       and B cell proliferation through iron uptake (PubMed:26642240).
CC       {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:26642240,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:3568132}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: (Microbial infection) Acts as a receptor for new-world
CC       arenaviruses: Guanarito, Junin and Machupo virus.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17287727, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18268337}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer; disulfide-linked. Binds one transferrin or HFE
CC       molecule per subunit. Binds the HLA class II histocompatibility
CC       antigen, DR1. Interacts with SH3BP3. Interacts with STEAP3;
CC       facilitates TFRC endocytosis in erythroid precursor cells
CC       (PubMed:26642240). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16325581,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:26642240}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: (Microbial infection) Interacts with Guanarito, Junin and
CC       Machupo arenavirus glycoprotein complex (PubMed:17287727,
CC       PubMed:18268337). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17287727,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:18268337}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Self; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-355727, EBI-355727;
CC       P02768:ALB; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-355727, EBI-714423;
CC       P02794:FTH1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-355727, EBI-713259;
CC       Q30201:HFE; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-355727, EBI-1028850;
CC       Q30201-1:HFE; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-355727, EBI-15489346;
CC       A5K736:PVX_094255 (xeno); NbExp=7; IntAct=EBI-355727, EBI-20622076;
CC       O43765:SGTA; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-355727, EBI-347996;
CC       Q9P0V3:SH3BP4; NbExp=6; IntAct=EBI-355727, EBI-1049513;
CC       P02787:TF; NbExp=11; IntAct=EBI-355727, EBI-714319;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cell membrane {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17081065};
CC       Single-pass type II membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17081065}. Melanosome
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17081065}. Note=Identified by mass
CC       spectrometry in melanosome fractions from stage I to stage IV.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17081065}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Transferrin receptor protein 1, serum form:
CC       Secreted {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17081065}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Regulated by cellular iron levels through binding of
CC       the iron regulatory proteins, IRP1 and IRP2, to iron-responsive
CC       elements in the 3'-UTR. Up-regulated upon mitogenic stimulation.
CC   -!- PTM: N- and O-glycosylated, phosphorylated and palmitoylated. The
CC       serum form is only glycosylated. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:1421756,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:1421757, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16335952,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19159218, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19349973,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:3582362}.
CC   -!- PTM: Proteolytically cleaved on Arg-100 to produce the soluble
CC       serum form (sTfR).
CC   -!- PTM: Palmitoylated on both Cys-62 and Cys-67. Cys-62 seems to be
CC       the major site of palmitoylation. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:3582362}.
CC   -!- DISEASE: Immunodeficiency 46 (IMD46) [MIM:616740]: An autosomal
CC       recessive primary immunodeficiency disorder characterized by
CC       early-onset chronic diarrhea, recurrent infections, hypo- or
CC       agammaglobulinemia, normal lymphocyte counts, intermittent
CC       neutropenia, and intermittent thrombocytopenia.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:26642240}. Note=The disease is caused by
CC       mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Serum transferrin receptor (sTfR) is used as a
CC       means of detecting erythropoietin (EPO) misuse by athletes and as
CC       a diagnostic test for anemia resulting from a number of conditions
CC       including rheumatoid arthritis, pregnancy, irritable bowel
CC       syndrome and in HIV patients.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Canine and feline parvoviruses bind human and
CC       feline transferrin receptors and use these receptors to enter and
CC       infect cells.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the peptidase M28 family. M28B subfamily.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAD92491.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology
CC       and Haematology;
CC       URL="http://atlasgeneticsoncology.org/Genes/TFRCID259ch3q29.html";

RP   SUMOYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-202; LYS-215; LYS-221;
RP   LYS-252; LYS-333; LYS-346; LYS-353; LYS-375; LYS-387; LYS-389;

RP   LYS-602; LYS-697; LYS-705; LYS-709; LYS-711; LYS-876 AND LYS-879, AND
RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RX   PubMed=28112733; DOI=10.1038/nsmb.3366;
RA   Hendriks I.A., Lyon D., Young C., Jensen L.J., Vertegaal A.C.,
RA   Nielsen M.L.;
RT   "Site-specific mapping of the human SUMO proteome reveals co-
RT   modification with phosphorylation.";
RL   Nat. Struct. Mol. Biol. 24:325-336(2017).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Involved in pre-mRNA splicing. Remains associated with
CC       spliced mRNA after splicing which probably involves interactions
CC       with the exon junction complex (EJC). Can trigger mRNA decay which
CC       seems to be independent of nonsense-mediated decay involving
CC       premature stop codons (PTC) recognition. May be involved in
CC       nuclear mRNA decay. Involved in regulation of signal-induced
CC       alternative splicing. During splicing of PTPRC/CD45 is proposed to
CC       sequester phosphorylated SFPQ from PTPRC/CD45 pre-mRNA in resting
CC       T-cells. Involved in cyclin-D1/CCND1 mRNA stability probably by
CC       acting as component of the SNARP complex which associates with
CC       both the 3'end of the CCND1 gene and its mRNA. Involved in
CC       response to DNA damage. Is excluced from DNA damage sites in a
CC       manner that parallels transcription inhibition; the function may
CC       involve the SNARP complex. Initially thought to play a role in
CC       transcriptional coactivation through its association with the TRAP
CC       complex; however, it is not regarded as a stable Mediator complex
CC       subunit. Cooperatively with HELZ2, enhances the transcriptional
CC       activation mediated by PPARG, maybe through the stabilization of
CC       the PPARG binding to DNA in presence of ligand. May play a role in
CC       the terminal stage of adipocyte differentiation. Plays a role in
CC       the positive regulation of the circadian clock. Acts as a
CC       coactivator of the CLOCK-ARNTL/BMAL1 heterodimer and promotes its
CC       transcriptional activator activity and binding to circadian target
CC       genes (PubMed:24043798). {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20123736,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20932480, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22424773,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23525231, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24043798}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Associated with the large multiprotein complex TRAP
CC       (Mediator complex-like). Interacts with SFPQ; the interaction is
CC       dependent on SFPQ phosphorylation at 'Thr-687' and inhibits
CC       binding of SFPQ to an ESS1 exonic splicing silencer element-
CC       containing RNA. Interacts with NXF1. Component of the SNARP
CC       complex which consists at least of SNIP1, SNW1, THRAP3, BCLAF1 and
CC       PNN. Associated with spliced mRNP complexes. Interacts with HELZ2
CC       and PPARG. Interacts with CLOCK and ARNTL/BMAL1 (By similarity).
CC       Component of a MACOM-like complex, named WTAP complex, composed of
CC       WTAP, ZC3H13, CBLL1, KIAA1429, RBM15, BCLAF1 and THRAP3.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q569Z6, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10198638,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17095540, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18794151,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20123736, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20932480,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23525231, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24100041}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P38919:EIF4A3; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-352039, EBI-299104;
CC       Q9UBU9:NXF1; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-352039, EBI-398874;
CC       P23246:SFPQ; NbExp=6; IntAct=EBI-352039, EBI-355453;
CC       Q13573:SNW1; NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-352039, EBI-632715;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20123736,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23525231}. Nucleus, nucleoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24100041}. Nucleus speckle
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24100041}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitous. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10198638}.
CC   -!- PTM: ADP-ribosylation during genotoxic stress promotes
CC       accumulation in nuclear speckles.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the BCLAF1/THRAP3 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAH37554.1; Type=Miscellaneous discrepancy; Note=Contaminating sequence. Potential poly-A sequence.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC   -!- WEB RESOURCE: Name=Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology
CC       and Haematology;
CC       URL="http://atlasgeneticsoncology.org/Genes/THRAP3ID42960ch1p34.html";
