RL   Submitted (NOV-2005) to the PDB data bank.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Couples tyrosine kinase signals with the activation of
CC       the Rho/Rac GTPases, thus leading to cell differentiation and/or
CC       proliferation.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with SHB (PubMed:12084069). Interacts with APS,
CC       GRB2, GRB3, DOCK2, SLA, TEC and ZNF655/VIK (PubMed:12393632,
CC       PubMed:12400014, PubMed:15558030). Interacts with SIAH2; without
CC       leading to its degradation (PubMed:10207103). Associates with
CC       BLNK, PLCG1, GRB2 and NCK1 in a B-cell antigen receptor-dependent
CC       fashion (PubMed:9697839). Interacts with CBLB; which inhibits
CC       tyrosine phosphorylation and down-regulates activity
CC       (PubMed:9399639). May interact with CCPG1. Interacts with CLNK.
CC       Interacts with THEMIS2 (By similarity). Interacts with NEK3 and
CC       this interaction is prolactin-dependent (PubMed:15618286).
CC       Interacts with ITK (PubMed:15661896). Interacts with PTK2B/PYK2
CC       (By similarity). Interacts with HCK. Interacts with PTK2B/PYK2
CC       (PubMed:19207108). Interacts (via SH2 domain) with SYK
CC       (PubMed:8986718). Interacts with ANKRD54. Interacts with CD6 (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P27870,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10207103, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12084069,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:12393632, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12400014,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15558030, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15618286,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15661896, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19207108,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8986718, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9399639,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9697839}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q8IZP0:ABI1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-375446;
CC       P00519:ABL1; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-375543;
CC       Q13480:GAB1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-517684;
CC       P62993:GRB2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-401755;
CC       Q07666:KHDRBS1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-1364;
CC       Q13094:LCP2; NbExp=9; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-346946;
CC       P08487:PLCG1 (xeno); NbExp=4; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-8013886;
CC       P63000:RAC1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-413628;
CC       P78314:SH3BP2; NbExp=8; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-727062;
CC       Q8N720:ZNF655; NbExp=5; IntAct=EBI-625518, EBI-625509;
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=P15498-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=P15498-2; Sequence=VSP_047563;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed in hematopoietic cells but
CC       not in other cell types.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The DH domain is involved in interaction with CCPG1.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on tyrosine residues by HCK in response to
CC       IFNG and bacterial lipopolysaccharide (LPS) (By similarity).
CC       Phosphorylated by FYN. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11005864}.

RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RX   PubMed=25944712; DOI=10.1002/pmic.201400617;
RA   Vaca Jacome A.S., Rabilloud T., Schaeffer-Reiss C., Rompais M.,

CC   -!- FUNCTION: V-SNARE that mediates vesicle transport pathways through
CC       interactions with t-SNAREs on the target membrane. These
CC       interactions are proposed to mediate aspects of the specificity of
CC       vesicle trafficking and to promote fusion of the lipid bilayers.
CC       Involved in vesicular transport from the late endosomes to the
CC       trans-Golgi network. Along with VAMP7, involved in an non-
CC       conventional RAB1-dependent traffic route to the cell surface used
CC       by KCNIP1 and KCND2. May be involved in increased cytokine
CC       secretion associated with cellular senescence.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18195106, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19138172}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with distinct SNARE complexes that contain
CC       either STX5 or STX6. Interacts with NAPA and, to a lesser extent,
CC       with NAPG. Identified in a complex containing STX6, STX12, VAMP4
CC       and VTI1A. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasmic vesicle
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19138172}. Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Single-pass type IV membrane protein {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q96AJ9-2; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q96AJ9-1; Sequence=VSP_039848;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the VTI1 family. {ECO:0000305}.

RN   [19]
RP   X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.00 ANGSTROMS) OF 285-324 IN COMPLEX WITH RBM7
RP   AND MTREX, SUBUNIT, INTERACTION WITH RBM7 AND MTREX, AND MUTAGENESIS
RP   OF LEU-295; LEU-299; PHE-309 AND MET-313.
RX   PubMed=27905398; DOI=10.1038/ncomms13573;
RA   Falk S., Finogenova K., Melko M., Benda C., Lykke-Andersen S.,
RA   Jensen T.H., Conti E.;
RT   "Structure of the RBM7-ZCCHC8 core of the NEXT complex reveals
RT   connections to splicing factors.";
RL   Nat. Commun. 7:13573-13573(2016).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Scaffolding subunit of the trimeric nuclear exosome
CC       targeting (NEXT) complex, a complex that directs a subset of non-
CC       coding short-lived RNAs for exosomal degradation. The RNA exosome
CC       is fundamental for the degradation of RNA in eukaryotic nuclei.
CC       Substrate targeting is facilitated by its cofactor MTREX, which
CC       links to RNA-binding protein adapters (PubMed:27871484). May be
CC       involved in pre-mRNA splicing (Probable).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:27871484, ECO:0000305|PubMed:16263084}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of a nuclear TRAMP-like complex, an ATP-
CC       dependent exosome regulatory complex consisting of a helicase
CC       (MTREX), an oligadenylate polymerase (TENT4B or TENT4A), and a
CC       substrate specific RNA-binding factor (ZCCHC7 or ZCCHC8). Several
CC       TRAMP-like complexes exist with specific compositions and are
CC       associated with nuclear, or nucleolar RNA exosomes. Identified in
CC       the spliceosome C complex. Component of the nuclear exosome
CC       targeting (NEXT) complex composed of MTREX, ZCCHC8, and RBM7 that
CC       directs a subset of non-coding short-lived RNAs for exosomal
CC       degradation (PubMed:27905398, PubMed:27871484). Interacts with
CC       proteins involved in RNA processing and degradation such as MTREX
CC       and RBM7 (PubMed:16263084, PubMed:27905398, PubMed:27871484).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11991638, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16263084,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21855801, ECO:0000269|PubMed:27871484,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:27905398}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P38398:BRCA1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-1263058, EBI-349905;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nucleoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16263084, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21855801}.
CC       Nucleus {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00768}. Note=Excluded from
CC       nucleolus. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21855801}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q6NZY4-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q6NZY4-2; Sequence=VSP_013717;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Slight accumulation in cells entering S phase of the
CC       cell cycle. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16263084}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylation at Thr-492 by GSK3 is triggered in cells
CC       entering mitosis; this phosphorylation is greatly enhanced by
CC       nocodazole treatment, but reduced by lithium.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16263084}.
